title: A Reasonable Alternative to COP26 and Preaching Climate Doom
sub_head: A Nobel Prize-winning economist considers the balance between climate policy’s costs and benefits.
body: Editor’s note: With November’s global climate conference in Glasgow wrapping up, important facts about climate change don’t always make it into the dominant media coverage. We’re here to help. Each Thursday contributor Bjorn Lomborg has provided some important background so readers can have a better understanding of the true effects of climate change and the real costs of climate policy.
